ygData.subject: AW: [eqbards] Armor
ygData.msgSnippet: grinding = making xp, grouping only for the purpose to make xp ... Von: Katye and Brandon [mailto:landmax13@attbi.com] Gesendet am: Mittwoch, 6. Februar 2002
ygData.messageBody:
grinding = making xp, grouping only for the purpose to make xp

-----Urspr├╝ngliche Nachricht-----
Von: Katye and Brandon [mailto:landmax13@...]
Gesendet am: Mittwoch, 6. Februar 2002 07:32
An: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Betreff: Re: [eqbards] Armor

What is grinding? Is that soloing?

Raub
37 songster
e marr


At 04:07 PM 02/05/2002 -0800, you wrote:

>I keep my imbrued/Sentry/Guardian pieces in the bank for raids. I wear my
>singing steel for grinding. Each has a use.
>Other stuff? I think tattered mantles are a good upgrade for
>shoulders. drop off gullerback in BW. He has a ton of hitpoints and is
>very MR but your other chants will do him in. Just be careful, his arms
>are a lot longer than they look P
>
> Christopher Sanders <christopher.sanders@...> wrote:
> Dilemma...I have some Singing Steel, and I have some Imbrued. Problem is,
>the pieces duplicate. Example, I have SS helm and Imbrued helm, SS arms
and
>Imbrued arm...etc. What is considered "better"? SS is real nice AC, but
>it's leaving my stats lacking. Imbrued has some pretty good stats, but at
>the cost of some AC.
>
>Some have mentioned they carry 2 sets of armor. I'd rather not do that,
>since I quickly get encumbered now as it is. Currently, my "fresh from the
>bank going out to do stuff" weight is around 80/113. Add some armor to
>that, and I'll be starting out encumbered.
>
>Also, I really need to look at my shoulder, back, and waist slots. My
>shoulders is still blood stained mantle, back is, I think decent, but don't
>know what my options are, and my waist is the Straw Spun Belt. Decent AC
at
>10, but at 6 weight, I think it's too heavy. I wouldn't mind options that
I
>could go and get myself solo, but I have a 51 shaman friend who can help.
>Oh, I'm 50, finally. :)
>
>Any and all suggestions are very welcome.
>
>Thanks!
>
>Atonal
